storm2013.subsystems
Class DriveTrain

java.lang.Object
  edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.command.Subsystem
      storm2013.subsystems.DriveTrain
All Implemented Interfaces:
NamedSendable, Sendable
public class DriveTrain
extends Subsystem

The subsystem that controls the drive train of the robot. It contains various methods that easily calculate the movement to make up for weird things in the robot, and it contains references to all of the devices that the robot has associated with the drive train.

Author:
Joe

DriveTrain()
          The constructor which simply enables the encoders and adds the gyro to the LiveWindow

The constructor which simply enables the encoders and adds the gyro to the LiveWindow

Method Detail

initDefaultCommand

public void initDefaultCommand()
Sets the default command for the drive train to run to be TankDrive.

Specified by:
initDefaultCommand in class Subsystem

arcadeDrive

public void arcadeDrive(double speed,
                        double turn)
Moves the robot based on a speed value and a turn value, kind of like using a joystick with 2 axes on an arcade game.

Parameters:
speed - The speed at which to drive. On a joystick, this would come from the forward/backward axis
turn - The amount to turn. On a joystick, the left/right axis value.

tankDrive

public void tankDrive(double leftValue,
                      double rightValue)
Gives specific values to the left and right motors.

Parameters:
leftValue - The value to output to the left motor
rightValue - The value to output to the right motor

getLeftDistance

public double getLeftDistance()
Gets the reading on the left encoder

Returns:
The encoder value

getRightDistance

public double getRightDistance()
Gets the reading on the right encoder. Negated because the 2 encoders face opposite directions

Returns:
The encoder value

clearEncoder

public void clearEncoder()
Resets the values of both encoders.

clearGyro

public void clearGyro()
Resets the gyro value.

getGyroAngle

public double getGyroAngle()
Returns the gyro's angle. Negated due to the gyro being upside down

Returns:
The angle the robot has turned
